title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Odisha to hold meeting on Jan 3 to finalise auction details for major, critical mineral blocks
items.summary:
- Jan 3, 2026 meeting to finalise the annual mineral auction calendar; Annexure-I (major minerals) and Annexure-II (critical/strategic minerals) map identified blocks with inputs from DMG, DoMG, OMC, GSI and MECL.
- Director of Mines and Geology to prepare a detailed PowerPoint; meeting will review block suitability, exploration status and auction readiness with attendance from IBM, OMC, GSI and MECL.
- Outlook: 35 major mines in 2026-27 calendar, with 6 critical mines in 2025-26 and 8 in 2027; all mines to be auctioned by 2026-27.

items.title: Punjab govt committed to making state preferred destination for MSMEs: Minister Sanjeev Arora
items.summary:
- Punjab govt commits to making Punjab a preferred destination for MSMEs through sustained engagement, reforms and Invest Punjab facilitation.
- MSMEs are the backbone; proposed investments over Rs 400 crore across auto components, logistics, cold chain, agri-infra and renewable energy.
- Arora pledges regular dialogue, policy support, and time-bound regulatory processes to speed approvals and project deployment.

items.title: Bridging the gender gap: Strategies for empowering women in India’s manufacturing workforce
items.summary:
- Targets skilling, safe workplaces, and gov schemes to boost women's manufacturing participation as India eyes a $5T economy.
- Actions: leadership programs, upskilling in automation, safer transport, on-site childcare, anti-harassment, bias-free hiring.
- Policy levers and models: Stand-Up India, PLI gender quotas, tax incentives, rural hiring, tier-2/3 plants, staffing-led sourcing.

items.title: FMCG companies refill all channels as GST dust settles; expect sales upswing
summary: GST dust settles: inventories across FMCG normalised, production at full capacity as firms rebuild stock ahead of a demand rebound next quarter.
Post-GST 2.0 channel disruptions ease as old packaging is phased out and re-pricing stabilises; Dabur expects H2 growth in the mid-to-high single digits with rural demand leading.
Industry-wide bullish on post-GST demand; with inventories normalised, GST rationalisation benefits are expected to reflect in sales in the near term.

items.title: India-New Zealand FTA means more jobs, incomes, trade: PM Christopher Luxon
items.summary: - The India–NZ FTA was concluded in December 2025 after rounds; tariff elimination on 100% tariff lines for India and expanded services offer.\n- It aims to boost jobs, incomes, exports, and labour-intensive sectors; introduces a 5,000-visa Temporary Employment Entry pathway for Indian professionals in skilled occupations.\n- It includes regulatory cooperation, simplified customs, SPS/TBT disciplines, and supports SMBs, agricultural productivity, and skill mobility.

items.title: AI data center boom forcing decade old, inefficient power plants back into service
items.summary:
- AI-driven data center demand is lifting electricity use and prices in PJM, reviving older oil- and gas-fired peaker plants such as Fisk in Houston.
- Utilities have postponed retirements for many peaker units as demand spikes, raising pollution and costs per kilowatt-hour while helping avert blackouts.
- The Fisk site sits on a former coal plant site, illustrating a broader trend of delaying retirements in PJM across legacy plants.

items.title: Electrical islanding project kicks off for Jabalpur defence units, emergency services
Sembcorp completes acquisition of ReNew Sun Bright
items.summary: - Sembcorp Industries completed the 100% acquisition of ReNew Sun Bright Pvt Ltd from ReNew Pvt Ltd, expanding its solar portfolio in India. - ReNew Sun Bright operates a 300 MW solar project at Fatehgarh, Rajasthan, and the deal lifts Sembcorp's India capacity to over 7.6 GW installed and under development. - Globally, Sembcorp's renewables portfolio is about 20.2 GW, with ongoing acquisitions contributing to growth.

items.title: China's industrial profits tumble at fastest pace in over a year
items.summary:
- November profits fell 13.1% YoY—the fastest in over a year—as weak domestic demand offset export resilience; October fell 5.5%.
- Jan–Nov profits up 0.1% YoY (vs 1.9% Jan–Oct); coal mining/washing down 47.3%, while automotive and high-tech rose.
- Policy support expected as 2025 growth target ~5%; Rhodium puts 2025 GDP at 2.5–3%, reflecting weak fixed-asset investment.

items.title: China revises aviation law to regulate drones, tighten safety rules
items.summary:
- China’s NPC Standing Committee approved revisions to the Civil Aviation Law to regulate unmanned aircraft, introducing airworthiness certification for entities in the drone lifecycle and a unique product ID per unit, effective July 1 next year.
- Since 2024, civil unmanned aircraft must be registered under real names; micro/light/small drones are exempt from airworthiness, while medium/large drones must apply to the CAAC for certification.
- The overhaul aims to grow the low-altitude economy (forecast >2 trillion yuan by 2030), tightening oversight and impacting major makers like DJI and EHang, with drone logistics driving rural delivery pilots.

items.title: India imposes anti-dumping duty on two Chinese products
UP may become home to Teema’s technology park
items.summary:
- Teema proposes a global network of tech parks in US, India, Mexico and Poland, with the first site in Sonora, Mexico, led by Foxconn’s Young Liu and V Lee.
- The plan blends Foxconn’s high-tech manufacturing and supply-chain strengths with CTCI’s engineering to build AI-driven, ESG-focused industrial clusters to aid Taiwanese firms and strengthen supply chains amid geopolitical risks.
- In India, Yeida is a frontrunner for a Teema park near Greater Noida/Jewar airport; the first phase will establish supply-chain integration platforms across four countries and boost SME participation.

items.title: Samsung is not going the LG way, rules out India IPO for now
items.summary:
- Samsung rules out an India IPO for now, prioritizing AI adoption and Finance+ EMI to drive growth across devices.
- Plans to deepen India's manufacturing footprint (Noida facility, local display production under PLI) for local and export demand.
- A broad AI roadmap for CES 2026, including AI-enabled appliances and a Gemini-enabled Family Hub fridge, backed by multi-centre R&D.

items.title: Make in India electronics: Cos create 1.33 million jobs as PLI scheme boosts smartphone sector
items.summary:
- 1.33 million total jobs created in five years due to PLI, including ~400k direct manufacturing roles and ~930k indirect roles.
- Wages, production, and exports: FY25 wages ~ Rs 25,000 crore; production rose to ~Rs 5.45 lakh crore; exports > Rs 2 lakh crore.
- Apple/Foxconn-led growth: iPhone production shifting domestically, India set to be a top mobile exporter by 2026; continued policy stability could unlock more jobs.

items.title: KSBC records ₹332.62 cr liquor sales in first four days of Christmas-New Year season
items.summary:
- KSBC BEVCO outlets sold ₹332.62 crore of liquor in Dec 22-25, up 18.99% from ₹229.54 crore a year earlier.
- Daily sales: ₹77.62 crore (Dec 22), ₹81.34 crore (Dec 23), ₹114.45 crore (Dec 24, highest single-day sale), ₹59.21 crore (Dec 25).
- KSBC defines the season as Dec 22-31 and expects further rise on Dec 30-31; Onam season KSBC sales were ₹970.74 crore; Consumerfed outlets limited and their figures will be available later.

items.title: Apollo Micro Systems secures ₹100 crore defence orders for unmanned aerial systems
items.summary:
- AMSL received DRDO approvals for two technology transfers: a multi-channel 10 kW laser-based DEW and an EO tracking system with EO sensors.
- It disclosed defence orders worth ₹100.2 crore to supply unmanned aerial systems to the Ministry of Defence, placed by a private contractor with a four-month delivery window.
- The DRDO clearances strengthen AMSL's position in indigenous advanced defence platforms and broaden its aerospace portfolio.

items.title: Successful launch of BlueBird satellite marks 'important day' for US-India partnership: Amb Kwatra
items.summary: India’s LVM3-M6 placed BlueBird-6, AST SpaceMobile’s Block-2 satellite, into orbit—the heaviest commercial satellite launched from Indian soil and a milestone for ISRO’s heavy-lift capability. The mission reinforces expanding US–India space cooperation and adds to India’s record of 434 satellites launched for 34 countries, aligning with broader Atmanirbharta goals alongside Axiom-4 and NISAR. Amb. Kwatra called it a milestone for the partnership and a platform to broaden domestic R&D and foreign collaborations.

items.title: South Korea charges 10 over alleged chip technology leak to China's CXMT
items.summary:
- Ten people indicted under Korea's industrial technology protection law for leaking DRAM tech to CXMT; a former Samsung researcher allegedly copied hundreds of process steps by hand.
- CXMT allegedly obtained extra DRAM tech from SK Hynix via a supplier, accelerating 10-nm DRAM development.
- The data allegedly enabled CXMT to produce 10-nm DRAM in 2023 and support HBM AI workloads, with Samsung losses in the trillions of won.

items.title: Saatvik Green Energy bags additional solar pumps order from Maharashtra state utility
items.summary:
- Saatvik secured an additional ₹16.74 crore order from MSEDCL to install 1,000 off-grid DC solar pumps under Magel Tyala Saur Krushi Pump Yojana/PM-KUSUM-B.
- Total SPWPS orders from MSEDCL reach 1,815 units worth ₹30.24 crore (ex GST), covering design through commissioning across Maharashtra.
- CEO Prashant Mathur says the order boosts momentum; Saatvik operates a 4.8 GW Ambala module plant and is building a 4 GW Odisha facility for multi-location vertical integration.
keywords: Magel Tyala Saur Krushi Pump Yojana

items.title: India’s import barriers on metallurgical coke are raising steelmaking costs, flags GTRI
items.summary:
- India’s protective coke-import measures and steel safeguards tighten a key input for blast-furnace steelmaking, raising production costs.
- GTRI warns that anti-dumping duties use container freight benchmarks, inflating costs versus bulk freight and eroding margins.
- With quotas expiring in 2025, the report urges expanding import access, treating coke as strategic, and recalibrating duties and steel policy alignment.

items.title: Bondada Engineering wins ₹391 crore order from NTPC Green Energy
items.summary:
- Bondada wins EPC & O&M contract (₹391.38 cr) from NTPC Green Energy for 300 MW Lalitpur solar project; scope covers design, supply, erection, testing, commissioning, plus 3 years O&M; completion in 15 months.
- This is Bondada's first NGEL order, lifting its EPC book to about 3.3 GW and signaling stronger public-sector engagement.
- The deal underscores NGEL's execution push in utility-scale solar infra and northern India deployment.

items.title: HNGIL appoints Rakesh Mehta as COO, North following INSCO acquisition
items.summary:
- HNGIL appointed Rakesh Mehta as COO, North, effective immediately, after INSCO acquisition by Madhvani Group's Independent Sugar Corporation Limited in Sept 2025.
- He will oversee northern manufacturing, supply chain, production ops and customer engagement across pharma, liquor, beverage and food packaging.
- Mehta has 20+ years in finance and operations, with prior roles at Reliance Jio Infocomm and Reliance Retail; appointment aims to strengthen northern ops and drive efficiency in glass packaging.

items.title: AMSL bags new defence orders worth over ₹100 crore
items.summary: - AMSL secures defence orders worth ₹1,002.47 million to supply unmanned aerial systems to the Ministry of Defence, with delivery in four months.\n- The orders come from a private company and reflect AMSL's tech-enabled solutions across infrastructure, transportation, aerospace and defence.\n- The deal was disclosed via an exchange filing.

items.title: India’s semiconductor journey: How 2025 shifted the focus from ambition to execution
items.summary:
- 2025 moved from ambition to execution, with incentives of ₹62.9k crore and electronics output near $115–120B, expanding focus to backend, OSAT/ATMP, packaging and testing.
- India retains a design edge (>20% of world design engineers) but needs stronger domestic demand aggregation and tighter coupling with packaging, testing and system manufacturing to close the value-chain gap.
- 2026 shifts to execution, treating semiconductors as strategic infrastructure, accelerating EMS growth and modernisation while addressing gaps in equipment, materials, land, water and power.

items.title: Concord Control Systems’ arm bags ₹56.58 crore Indian Railways contract
items.summary:
- Concord Control Systems wins ₹56.58 crore Indian Railways contract to supply, install and commission locomotive wireless control systems via its subsidiary Advanced Rail Controls, lifting the order book to over ₹450 crore and strengthening engagement across safety and control segments.
- The systems enable real-time train operations coordination and reflect Concord’s leadership in India’s railway-technology journey, with an emphasis on India-made technologies and Kavach 4.0 contributions through its stake in Progota India.
- Advanced Rail Controls also secured another Indian Railways order valued at ₹139.32 crore for the same scope, expanding its locomotive wireless control system portfolio.

items.title: ISRO launches 390 foreign satellites into orbit since 2014, cements global launch credentials
items.summary:
- ISRO has launched 390 satellites for 34 countries since 2014, boosting cost-effective global space services.
- PSLV's 2017 milestone of 104 satellites in one mission showcased versatility across payloads and orbits.
- By early 2025, India ranked among the top five spacefaring nations with its 100th launch, aided by SpaDEx docking for on-orbit servicing.

items.title: Tata Steel arm faces $1.6 billion class action lawsuit in Dutch court over alleged health damage
items.summary:
- Stichting Frisse Wind filed a WAMCA collective action in the District Court of North Holland against Tata Steel Nederland B.V. and Tata Steel IJmuiden B.V. seeking about $1.6 billion for alleged environmental and health damages near Velsen-Noord.
- Writ served Dec 19, 2025 on residents; claimants allege emissions increased health risks and depressed home values; Tata Steel denies the claims and plans to defend.
- Two-phase proceedings (admissibility and merits) are expected to take 2-3 years each; Tata Steel says it is investing in environmental improvements via Roadmap+ and Green Steel Plan.

items.title: Rural demand driving construction equipment market, say CASE Construction top executives
items.summary:
- Rural demand is decentralising from metros to tier-2/3 towns as rural projects rise; first-time buyers acquire loaders, compactors and excavators locally, while large fleets still buy in bulk.
- Government schemes like Jal Jeevan Mission and PMGSY are boosting demand; CASE links with financiers and an NBFC to expand retail finance; rising telematics improve service, fuel use and reminders.
- Outlook: Stage-V prompted machine redesign with 2-10% model gains; 2025-26 recovery expected, with high single-digit growth in 2026 on a low base; rural infrastructure and service capability are key drivers.

items.title: Dilip Buildcon bags ₹3,400 crore EPC order for Ganga Path road in Bihar
items.summary:
- Dilip Buildcon bags ₹3,400 crore EPC to build 41.09-km Ganga Path from Sultanganj–Bhagalpur to Sabour, Bihar, with a 42-month window from start.
- Project on a back-to-back basis with Bihar State Road Development Corporation as employer; scope includes design, engineering, procurement, construction, testing and commissioning.
- Declared L-1 bidder by REC PDC Ltd for a 400 kV sub-station at Mekhali, Belagavi, Karnataka (400/220/33 kV AIS) and associated lines; also received a ₹879.30 crore LOA from NHAI for four-laning NH-87 Paramakudi–Ramanathapuram in Tamil Nadu.

items.title: Colgate India gets ₹267 crore demand order from taxman
items.summary:
- Colgate-Palmolive (India) has a ₹267.64 crore tax demand for FY2021-22, driven by transfer-pricing adjustments and disallowance of certain expenses.
- The company will appeal to the tax tribunal; the management asserts the demand does not impact operations or financials.
- In the September quarter, net profit fell 17% YoY, with industry concerns about tax certainty and dispute resolution affecting ease of doing business.

items.title: Want to be known as world leader in power electronics: Suramya Nevatia, CMD, Hind Rectifiers
items.summary:
- Suramya Nevatia says power electronics is core across rail, defence, mobility and energy; Hind Rectifiers shifts from components to end-to-end train systems with in-house propulsion and control.
- Locomotives (~6,000 hp) are the proving ground; Railways offer long demand visibility; the group diversifies beyond rail toward modules and integrated solutions with gradual overseas roll-out.
- By 2030–2035, Hind Rectifiers aims to be a world leader in power electronics, anchored by IP and in-house R&D; exports target 20–30% of revenue.

items.title: At WTO, India calls for steps to boost tech transfer to developing nations
items.summary:
- Calls on WTO members to adopt measures that promote transfer of relevant, advanced and environmentally sound technology to developing nations and LDCs.
- Highlights barriers such as export controls on inputs (semiconductors, rare earths) and inflexible IP regimes, urging transparency and a fair share in trade.
- Pushes a time-bound roadmap to operationalise TRIPS flexibilities and tech-transfer provisions before the next ministerial conference.

items.title: Jewellery, rugs and toys power creative goods' export surge
items.summary: - Exports rose 7.3% YoY to $12.5B (Apr–Oct FY26), led by fashion jewellery, crafts, carpets and toys; UAE 31% of shipments, US 26.1%.\n- Front-loading from US tariffs and Christmas orders boosted shipments; lab-grown diamonds gain traction in fashion jewellery with buyers in US, Spain, UK, UAE, NL.\n- India held ~3% of global creative goods exports in 2023; high gold prices boost imitation jewellery as FTAs loom and 2026 outlook remains challenging.

items.title: Dept of atomic energy seeks sops to put N-Power on a par with RE
items.summary:
- DAE seeks GST waivers, green financing, renewables-like purchase obligations, green taxonomy inclusion, and removal from CPCB Red status.
- Nuclear power emits near-zero CO2 but isn’t treated as renewable; post-Shanti Bill 2025 regime opens private investment.
- GST deemed exports exclude nuclear (18% IGST vs ~5% for renewables); customs exemptions extended to Sept 2027; India targets 100 GW by 2047 from 8.78 GW.

items.title: Now hiring: Leaders for a ‘Global’ India
items.summary:
- GCCs in India are shifting from transactional back-office hubs to strategic, expanding leadership in product, engineering, data, AI, cybersecurity and digital operations.
- ANSR projects GCC leadership headcount rising from about 6,500 end-2024 to about 8,500 end-2025, with roughly 40% more by end-2026; BFSI, retail and consumer durables show high-growth momentum and cross-sector demand.
- Firms such as Albertsons, McDonald’s, FedEx, Sanofi and Intuit are expanding GCC leadership, signaling AI-native operating models and India-owned global portfolios across sectors.

items.title: Taiwan’s MediaTek is open to sourcing more India chips
items.summary:
- MediaTek is open to sourcing more India chips as the ecosystem matures, shifting between assembly and manufacturing based on cost and foundry readiness.
- Fabless MediaTek holds ~46% of India's chipset market and is expanding a 1,000-strong India R&D footprint to integrate hardware, software, AI and connectivity.
- It targets premium Dimensity chips, automotive and data-center solutions, on-device AI with NPUs, and says 2030 success will rely on IoT and automotive ecosystem leadership not market share.

items.title: India Inc wants to tech all its employees to the future
items.summary:
• India Inc is lining up 2026 upskilling targets with data, AI and analytics at the core, backed by academia partnerships and in‑house learning ecosystems.
• Firms such as GCPL, EY, Zensar, Tata Motors and Diageo are launching or expanding learning platforms and forums (RIDE, AI Varsity, Learning University) to future‑proof talent.
• The strategy ties learning to promotions, emphasizes bite‑size content, and aligns HR with disruptions in hydrogen propulsion, batteries and software‑defined vehicles.

items.title: Exports likely to grow by 3% to ₹850 bn this fiscal: GTRI
items.summary:
- GTRI projects India’s total exports at about USD 850 bn in FY26, up ~3% from FY25, with services possibly exceeding USD 400 bn.
- Goods exports likely flat; headwinds include protectionism, weaker global demand, and climate-related barriers like the EU’s CBAM from Jan 2026.
- External environment is deteriorating; CBAM costs impact steel exports to the EU; calls for sector-by-sector FTAs to better integrate firms into global value chains.

items.title: New labour codes may reshape MNC payrolls
items.summary:
- India’s broader wage definition under the labour codes could reshape cost bases for seconded/expat staff and TP, triggering adjustments if benchmarks change or docs are weak.
- The revised wage framework will affect wage definitions, social contributions, compliance timelines and benefits, altering payroll structures and overall CTC, requiring cross-functional rollout.
- Aggressive reclassification of salary components may attract GAAR if arrangements lack commercial substance; robust rationale, board approvals and mappings to old components are essential.

items.title: India's engineering goods exports record strong rebound in November at $11.01 billion: EEPC
items.summary:
- Engineering exports rose to $11.01B in Nov 2025, up 23.76% YoY from $8.90B in Nov 2024; first time crossing $11B in the current fiscal. 
- Apr–Nov 2025–26 exports total $79.74B, up 4.25% YoY; US ($1.58B, +11.4%) and EU ($2.02B, +39%) are top destinations. 
- 32 of 34 product panels grew; engineering's share of total merchandise exports rose to 28.9%; policy supports and potential FTAs with EU/US on the horizon.

items.title: North Korea displays apparent progress in construction of nuclear-powered submarine
items.summary:
- KCNA photos show an 8,700-ton hull of a nuclear-powered submarine largely complete, with Kim Jong Un visiting the shipyard to stress modernization and deterrence.
- Analysts say core components, including engine and possibly the reactor, may be installed, hinting at sea trials within months; reactor sourcing is debated.
- The move is part of Kim's broader weapons push and raises tensions as South Korea eyes a U.S.-backed submarine program.

items.title: Samsung rules out India listing, to focus on AI-integration, interest-free finance to fuel growth
items.summary:
- Samsung rules out India listing and will push AI integration across devices, expanding Finance+ EMI to home appliances, funded internally with optional borrowings.
- It will deepen its Noida footprint, push display manufacturing under the PLI, and grow exports with AI-driven differentiation in rural and north/east markets.
- AI is a cornerstone for future products, with CES 2026 AI appliances and on-device AI Vision via Google Gemini; India hosts 10,000+ engineers across 3 R&D centers.

items.title: Ola Electric gets ₹366.78 crore PLI-Auto incentive sanction for FY25
items.summary:
- Ola Electric sanctioned ₹366.78 crore under the government PLI Auto scheme for FY25.
- Payment will be disbursed via IFCI Limited and tied to demand incentives linked to determined sales value.
- Aims to boost domestic auto manufacturing, advanced technologies, and India's global competitiveness in clean mobility.

items.title: Lamborghini bets on hybrids to drive sustainable growth, manufacturing overhaul
items.summary:
- Lamborghini aims for carbon-neutral operations at Sant’Agata Bolognese while shifting to hybrid powertrains, cutting CO2 since 2014.
- The Manufacturing \"Manufactura Lamborghini\" enables ICE, hybrid and EV on a single line, mixing automation with craftsmanship.
- A factory expansion adds an in-house paint shop, more on-site solar, water monitoring and circular economy practices with safety and upskilling for high-voltage systems.

items.title: Sun Pharma arm recalls over 17,000 units of antifungal shampoo in US: USFDA
items.summary: - Taro Pharmaceuticals (a Sun Pharma unit) recalls 17,664 Ciclopirox Shampoo bottles in the US due to impurity/degradation specs; Class II recall began Dec 9.\n- Ciclopirox Shampoo is used to treat seborrheic dermatitis (antifungal).\n- The 2024 merger made Taro a private subsidiary of Sun Pharma; Sun Pharma has been the majority owner since 2010.

items.title: Ashwini Vaishnaw: Rahul Gandhi's praise for Karnataka jobs affirms Make in India success
items.summary:
- Rahul Gandhi praised Karnataka's Foxconn-linked hiring: ~30,000 jobs in 8–9 months; majority women (≈80%), many aged 19–24.
- Vaishnaw called Gandhi's remarks proof of Make in India; notes Covid-era push to diversify Apple suppliers under PLI for mobiles/electronics.
- Foxconn expanding in India, especially Tamil Nadu, with possible new facilities in Uttar Pradesh; incentives from BJP-led states and center.

items.title: HCCB, Coca-Cola India’s bottling arm, to lay off 300 employees; move to streamline operations
items.summary:
- Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages to lay off about 300 employees (4–6% of ~5,000) to streamline operations across sales, supply chain, distribution and bottling.
- CEO Hemant Rupani (ex-Mondelez) guiding the unit under Coca-Cola’s concentrate-to-bottler model; operates 15 manufacturing units.
- FY25 net profit fell 73% to ₹756.64 crore and revenue declined 9% to ₹12,751.29 crore amid base effects from bottling-sale exits and muted demand due to unseasonal rains.

items.title: Amit Shah inaugurates ₹2 Lakh crore projects at MP Growth Summit, boosting employment
items.summary:
- Amit Shah inaugurated the Abhyudaya MP Growth Summit in Gwalior, unveiling projects worth ₹2 lakh crore and a groundbreaking ceremony.
- The event saw renovation of the Atal Museum and the launch of the Gwalior Fair, with about 25,000 beneficiaries and numerous entrepreneurs and investors.
- Officials project about 1.93 lakh employment opportunities, framing MP's growth as part of a holistic Viksit Bharat vision.

items.title: Samsung SDI, KG Mobility form alliance for cylindrical battery pack for future EVs: Report
items.summary:
- Samsung SDI and KG Mobility have signed a long-term strategic alliance to co-design, test, and validate cylindrical battery packs based on Samsung SDI’s 46-series cells for KG Mobility’s next-generation EVs. 
- The 46-series cells are designed for high energy density using nickel, cobalt, aluminum and silicon-carbon technology to enable longer range and faster charging while maintaining safety. 
- The partners will share global battery-market strategies and conduct joint R&D, signaling cylindrical chemistry as a growth area amid rising demand for producible, scalable battery solutions.

items.title: Adani seals ₹80,000 crore in deals since 2023 Hindenburg crisis
items.summary:
- Since Jan 2023, Adani has closed 33 acquisitions totalling ~₹80,000 crore, led by ports, cement and power.
- The largest deal: ₹21,700 crore for North Queensland Export Terminal (April 2025).
- Analysts cite improved transparency, lender engagement, deleveraging and a planned ~₹10 lakh crore capex over five years to restore investor confidence.
